member.name: M:Skybrud.Csv.CsvFile.Escape(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Helper method for escaping special characters (eg. double quotes and line breaks). If the value contains any characters that should be escaped, the value will be enclosed with double quotes. The value will not be modified if it doesn't contain invalid characters.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Csv.CsvFile.GetEncodingByBom(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Attempts to the find encoding of the specified by checking for the BOM header of various unicode encodings.
member.returns: An instance of if successful; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Csv.CsvFile.GetEncodingBySeek(System.Byte[],System.String@)
member.summary: Attemps to find the encoding of the specified by certain special characters are successfully converted using different encodings.
member.param: When this method returns, holds the plain text string represented by if successful; otherwise, null.
member.returns: An instance of if successful; otherwise, null.
member.remarks: This method may be expensive as worst case scenario is that the method will run through each byte in one time for each encoding the method is checking against. Using Big O notation, the performance can be described like O(N * M) where N is the length of and M is the encodings that the method is checking against (currently two). Based on this, we can determine that iterations increase linearly, which is not super bad, but it might still include a lot of iterations as grow.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Csv.CsvFile._characters
member.summary: Defines a set of reference characters that we'll check against to determine the encoding.

member.name: T:Skybrud.Csv.CsvSeparator
member.summary: Enum class representing the separator used in a CSV file.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Csv.CsvSeparator.Auto
member.summary:
For load operations, this will indicate that should automatically try to detect the encoding - eg. based on the BOM header of the file if present.
This value shouldn't be used for save operations. If it is, will be used instead.
